game.name: Maniac Mansion
game.notes:
No known issues, game is completable.
- Amiga, Apple II, Atari ST, Commodore 64, Macintosh, NES and PC versions supported by this target
- Apple II and Commodore 64 versions aren't completable
- Minor graphical glitches in NES version

game.name: Zak McKracken and the Alien Mindbenders
game.notes:
No known issues, game is completable.
- Amiga, Atari ST, Commodore 64, FM-TOWNS and PC versions supported by this target
- No music or sound effects in the Commodore 64 version
- Kanji version requires the FM-TOWNS Font ROM

game.name: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
game.notes:
Game is completable
- Amiga, Atari ST, FM-TOWNS, Macintosh and PC versions supported by this target
- There is no support for the Macintosh interface
- Kanji version requires the FM-TOWNS Font ROM

game.name: Loom
game.notes:
No known issues, game is completable.
- Amiga, Atari ST, FM-TOWNS, Macintosh and PC versions supported by this target
- The Roland update from LucasArts is required for MIDI support in the EGA version
- No music or sound effects in the Macintosh version
- There is no support for the Macintosh interface
- Fades are seemingly different in the FM-TOWNS version
- Text palette sometimes incorrect in the FM-TOWNS version
- Distaff occasionally pink in the FM-TOWNS version
- Use boot parameter to choose difficulty in the FM-TOWNS version:
0 practice (default)
1 standard
2 expert
- Kanji version requires the FM-TOWNS Font ROM

game.name: Passport to Adventure
game.notes: No known issues, game is completable.

game.name: The Secret of Monkey Island
game.notes:
No known issues, game is completable.
- Amiga, Atari ST, FM-TOWNS, Macintosh, PC and SegaCD versions supported by this target
- The Roland update from LucasArts is required for MIDI support in the EGA version
- No music or sound effects in the Amiga version
- Dialogue choices in the SegaCD version can be selected with mousewheel or keyboard arrow keys

game.name: Monkey Island 2: LeChuck's Revenge
game.notes:
No known issues, game is completable.
- Amiga, FM-TOWNS, Macintosh and PC versions supported by this target
- Demo version often crashes due to missing resources, since it was never meant to be playable
- No support for playing back the recorded file of gameplay in demo version
- Kanji version requires the FM-TOWNS Font ROM

game.name: Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis
game.notes:
No known issues, game is completable.
- Amiga, FM-TOWNS, Macintosh and PC versions supported by this target
- Kanji version requires the FM-TOWNS Font ROM

game.name: Day of the Tentacle
game.notes:
No known issues, game is completable.
- Both Macintosh and PC versions supported by this target
- Maniac Mansion isn't playable on Ed's computer. To play the included copy, use 'Add Game' from the main ScummVM launcher and select the MANIAC directory inside the DOTT game directory

game.name: Sam & Max Hit the Road
game.notes:
No known issues, game is completable.
- Both Macintosh and PC versions supported by this target

game.name: Full Throttle

game.name: The Curse of Monkey Island
game.notes: No known issues, game is completable.

game.name: Leather Goddesses of Phobos 2
game.notes:
Game is completable.
- The DOS floppy version is supported by this target
- Only soundblaster music is played. MIDI music playing/MT32 instrument mapping needs more work

game.name: The Manhole
game.notes: Game is playable.

game.name: Return to Zork
game.notes:
Game is completable.
- DOS floppy and CD versions are supported by this target
- The 3DO, Macintosh, PC-FX, PlayStation and SEGA Saturn versions are not supported
- Only soundblaster music is played. MIDI music playing/MT32 instrument mapping needs more work

game.name: Rodney's Funscreen
game.notes:
Game is playable.
- The DOS floppy version is supported by this target

game.name: Elvira - Mistress of the Dark
game.notes:
No known issues, game is completable.
- Amiga and Atari ST and DOS versions are supported by this target
- Commodore 64 version doesn't use AGOS, so will never be supported.
- No music in the Atari ST version.

game.name: Elvira II - The Jaws of Cerberus
game.notes:
No known issues, game is playable.
- Amiga and Atari ST and DOS versions are supported by this target
- Commodore 64 version doesn't use AGOS, so will never be supported.
- No music in the Atari ST version.
- No sound effects in the DOS version.

game.name: Simon the Sorcerer 1
game.notes:
No known issues, game is completable.
- Acorn, Amiga, DOS and Windows versions supported by this target
- No music in Acorn disk version

game.name: Simon the Sorcerer 2
game.notes:
No known issues, game is completable.
- Amiga, DOS, Macintosh and Windows versions supported by this target

- F10 key animation is different in Amiga & Macintosh versions

game.name: Bargon Attack

game.name: Gobliiins
game.notes:

game.name: Gobliins 2
game.notes:
Game is completable

game.name: Goblins 3
game.notes:
Game is completable
- Amiga, Atari, DOS and Macintosh versions are supported by this target
- Issues with the mouse cursor visibility
- No support for original font and music files in Macintosh version
- The number of used jokers isn't saved correctly. You'll always have 5 to spend again after loading

game.name: Lost in Time
game.notes:
Game is completable
- DOS floppy and CD versions are supported by this target
- Versions that split part one and two are untested
- Issues with the mouse cursor visibility

game.name: The Bizarre Adventures of Woodruff and the Schnibble
game.notes:

- PC CD versions are supported by this target

game.name: Ween: The Prophecy
game.notes:
Game is completable
- Amiga, Atari and DOS versions are supported by this target
- Issues with the mouse cursor visibility

game.name: Beneath a Steel Sky
game.notes:
No known issues, game is completable.
- Requires the sky.cpt resource file to be placed in the game directory
- Floppy demos aren't supported
- Amiga versions aren't supported
The following bugs are present in the original game and can't be fixed:
- The voice files for some sentences are missing.
    This is especially noticeable in the court- and Mrs. Piermont sequence.
- The fonts for the LINC terminal are partially incorrect and the text sometimes passes the screen borders
- Special characters for french and italian subtitles are incorrect sometimes

game.name: Flight of the Amazon Queen

game.name: The Legend of Kyrandia
game.notes:
Game is completable
- Requires the kyra.dat resource file to be placed in the game directory
- Amiga, DOS, FM-TOWNS, Macintosh and PC-9821 versions are supported
- Occasional graphics glitches
- No music or sound effects in the Amiga and Macintosh floppy versions
- Macintosh CD is using included DOS music and sound effects
- PC-9821 version lacks support for sound effects

game.name: The 7th Guest
game.notes:

game.name: Backyard Soccer
game.notes:

- Players on field are stuck in upper left corner and can't be controlled
- Minor graphical glitches
